title: Data Analysis and Statistics for Political Science
text:
Preface

This is a book primarily for undergraduate students taking a course in data analysis and statistics. Many statistics and data science books are geared toward general audiences or statistics students. Those books typically do not contain many political science examples. This book is designed to gives students a foundation in data analysis and statistics but with explicitly political science examples. The use of examples helps solidify complicated concepts surrounding statistics. Political science students will relate to these political science examples and facilitate mastery of the content.

title: About the Author
text: Brandon L. Bartels is a Professor of Political Science at George Washington University.
